author: Staff Reporter
text:
In a peculiar theft case, four sovereigns of gold jewellery were stolen from the house of a Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation driver by a woman, who claimed to be his daughter’s schoolmate.

According to a complaint filed by G. Thangaraj (54) from Appakarai near Peraiyur, a woman with a toddler came to his house on Wednesday. She allegedly introduced herself as a classmate of Thangaraj’s daughter when the two were in Class 12 and that she had moved to Thoothukudi since then.

Believing in her claims, Thangaraj extended hospitality to her, the police said. In the afternoon, as Thangaraj had to leave for work, he asked the woman to wait at home until his daughter arrived.

However, when Thangaraj’s daughter reached home, she allegedly found the house locked. When she contacted Thangaraj over phone, he narrated what had happened.

On entering the house after opening it with help from a neighbour, Thangaraj’s daughter found that the woman had decamped with four sovereigns of gold jewellery kept in the cupboard.

A case was registered on Friday.
title: Woman decamps with gold jewellery
